d2p1:AnswerSentence.d2p1:Text: They did not bring a map.

d2p1:Material.d2p1:Text:
Two male hikers missing in the Amazon rain forest in Brazil were found this afternoon, one week after what they had planned to be only a two-day hike. The hikers could not find their way around after much heavier rainfall than normal resulted in flooding, which destroyed their maps and other navigation devices. After a thorough search of a 500-mile area, a rescue helicopter picked them up 50 miles from where they had initially set off. The search and rescue team were alerted to the men’s position after noticing a fire that they had created to help identify their location. The men have now been safely reunited with relieved family members.

Apparently, the hikers managed to survive by eating fruit growing in the area, although they were very low on potable water when they were found. When interviewed, one of the men said of the experience: “I am hugely relieved to be back with my family. I refused to give up hope of being rescued and tried to stay as positive as possible. This has definitely been a more challenging adventure than I had anticipated, but I can’t say that this has put me off from taking future hikes.”

d2p1:QuestionText.d2p1:Text: Why did the hikers get lost?

d2p1:AnswerSentence.d2p1:Text: It showed where the hikers were.

d2p1:AnswerSentence.d2p1:Text: to describe research findings about male elephant behavior
to explain why male elephants usually live alone
to compare female and male elephant behavior
to examine the relationship between young and old elephants

d2p1:Material.d2p1:Text:
Elephant society is generally very hierarchical. Females form groups consisting of female kin, including a matriarch that makes decisions about daily and seasonal activities. Males, conversely, are usually regarded to be solitary. However, research indicates that males are more social than originally thought. Observations over the last 20 years in Africa show that male elephants form groups in which they develop long-term friendships. To explore the dynamics of these relationships, researchers studied a group of 15 males with one dominant male leading the group.

Typically, males live with a female group until the age of 12 to 15. Afterwards, they spend time alone and socialize with other bulls in small groups dominated by stronger, older bulls. When bulls are not in musth, a hormonal state in which they become unpredictable and aggressive as they focus on finding mates, they work to maintain long-term friendships with bulls that are unrelated to them, demonstrating friendship with ritual behaviors. For example, the dominant male will physically push other bulls in order to round up the group and even successfully fight back challenges against bulls in musth. Additionally, an elephant will dip its trunk into a dominant bull’s mouth to show respect. These behaviors support the existence of stronger social networks than previously believed.

d2p1:QuestionText.d2p1:Text: What is the purpose of this passage?

d2p1:AnswerSentence.d2p1:Text: They determine what the group does.
They maintain relationships with young males.
They help reduce aggressive behavior in males.
They dominate the male and female groups.

d2p1:Material.d2p1:Text:
Elephant society is generally very hierarchical. Females form groups consisting of female kin, including a matriarch that makes decisions about daily and seasonal activities. Males, conversely, are usually regarded to be solitary. However, research indicates that males are more social than originally thought. Observations over the last 20 years in Africa show that male elephants form groups in which they develop long-term friendships. To explore the dynamics of these relationships, researchers studied a group of 15 males with one dominant male leading the group.

Typically, males live with a female group until the age of 12 to 15. Afterwards, they spend time alone and socialize with other bulls in small groups dominated by stronger, older bulls. When bulls are not in musth, a hormonal state in which they become unpredictable and aggressive as they focus on finding mates, they work to maintain long-term friendships with bulls that are unrelated to them, demonstrating friendship with ritual behaviors. For example, the dominant male will physically push other bulls in order to round up the group and even successfully fight back challenges against bulls in musth. Additionally, an elephant will dip its trunk into a dominant bull’s mouth to show respect. These behaviors support the existence of stronger social networks than previously believed.

d2p1:QuestionText.d2p1:Text: Why are matriarchs important to some elephant groups?

d2p1:AnswerSentence.d2p1:Text: They now understand that bulls develop lifelong friendships.
They realize that bulls give up their friendships after musth.
They found that bulls’ social networks are stronger than females’.
They learned that musth helps bulls develop stronger social networks.

Males, conversely, are usually regarded to be solitary. However, research indicates that males are more social than originally thought. Observations over the last 20 years in Africa show that male elephants form groups in which they develop long-term friendships. To explore the dynamics of these relationships, researchers studied a group of 15 males with one dominant male leading the group.

Typically, males live with a female group until the age of 12 to 15. Afterwards, they spend time alone and socialize with other bulls in small groups dominated by stronger, older bulls. When bulls are not in musth, a hormonal state in which they become unpredictable and aggressive as they focus on finding mates, they work to maintain long-term friendships with bulls that are unrelated to them, demonstrating friendship with ritual behaviors. For example, the dominant male will physically push other bulls in order to round up the group and even successfully fight back challenges against bulls in musth. Additionally, an elephant will dip its trunk into a dominant bull’s mouth to show respect. These behaviors support the existence of stronger social networks than previously believed.

d2p1:Material.d2p1:Text:
Everyone in business knows the importance of presenting information effectively. A good presentation can serve a variety of purposes, such as introducing new ideas or promoting a product.

In order to be successful, a presentation should not only be based on facts, but it should also aim to keep the audience engaged. One way to achieve that is to focus on information that is related to the presentation topic. For example, if the presentation is about a new product, spending too much time discussing the old product it proposes to replace may confuse the listeners and make the talk less effective.

Another way to ensure that the audience listens carefully is to ask them questions about data or information that is shared during the presentation. This keeps people involved and makes them want to learn more. It is also important to maintain eye contact with everyone. This helps to check whether people have understood what is being discussed. Finally, presenters should not forget to smile once in a while. Smiling shows that they are interested in both the topic and the audience.

d2p1:QuestionText.d2p1:Text: According to the author, what should be shared with the audience during a presentation?

For example, if the presentation is about a new product, spending too much time discussing the old product it proposes to replace may confuse the listeners and make the talk less effective.

Another way to ensure that the audience listens carefully is to ask them questions about data or information that is shared during the presentation. This keeps people involved and makes them want to learn more. It is also important to maintain eye contact with everyone. This helps to check whether people have understood what is being discussed. Finally, presenters should not forget to smile once in a while. Smiling shows that they are interested in both the topic and the audience.

d2p1:Material.d2p1:Text:
"[SCRIPT:
F: Mr. Smith, do you have a moment?
M: Sure, what do you need?
F: Well, I need some advice. I’ve been offered a management position in the company, but it’s not in the training department. I really like my job now as a trainer and look forward to coming to work every day. The management job does pay a lot more, but I’m not sure if I should accept it.
M: Hmm… That’s a tough decision. Why do you like training so much?
F: I love to help people learn and succeed. But, I was told that I can’t move up in the organization if I keep doing the same thing.
M: Maybe if you succeed in this new position, you can take the management skills you develop back to the training department in the future. Accepting this promotion now doesn’t mean you have to stay in the position forever.
F: I never thought about it that way. Thanks!]"

Eric ______ dinner when his friends called, so he didn't go to the restaurant with them.

d2p1:Material.d2p1:Text: It is very important to be yourself, whether you are at home or in the office. Even though it may be tempting to act like people you admire or go along with their opinions, people need to learn how to chart their own course in life by developing their own viewpoints. People do this by listening carefully to what people say, reading, and analysing situations. However, at work some people make the mistake of trying to imitate their bosses, sometimes to impress others and other times just to impress the boss. Imitating your boss can actually backfire if your boss is not highly regarded by colleagues. Likewise, agreeing with everyone all the time is not good for business or for your own growth. It limits your effectiveness as an employee and as a colleague. Instead, when there is a problem, listen to your boss, gather information about the situation, and, if necessary, seek the advice of others to come up with your own solutions. Then, when the time is right, you are prepared to offer suggestions. This will help you become a team player, which is a highly desirable trait in today’s workplace.

d2p1:QuestionText.d2p1:Text: Select a suitable title for the passage.

d2p1:AnswerSentence.d2p1:Text: do not follow your boss’s ideas blindly

Then, when the time is right, you are prepared to offer suggestions. This will help you become a team player, which is a highly desirable trait in today’s workplace.

d2p1:QuestionText.d2p1:Text: What will the man’s proposal probably include?

d2p1:Material.d2p1:Text:
"[SCRIPT:
M: Hi, Kate. Do you have a second?
F: Sure, Greg. It looks like you’ve got something on your mind.
M: Well, I’ve been going over our numbers from the past three quarters, and I’m noticing a trend.
F: That report isn’t due until the end of the year, you know.
M: I know, but I started to see a pretty clear pattern with our advertising, and I think it may need to be addressed sooner rather than later.
F: OK, what are you seeing?
M: Well, since we started allocating more funds to our television ad campaign, we haven’t seen much of a change in the number of clients in the eighteen to thirty-year-old age bracket. Sales in the over forty category have jumped, but still, we’re missing out on a significant market segment that just doesn’t watch much TV. They’re more active on the Internet and social media.
F: Hmm… You’re right. That should have been anticipated. Can you put together a brief proposal based on your analysis?
M: Absolutely. I’ll send that your way by tomorrow morning.]"
